metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Text Effects
CSS Text Overflow, Word Wrap, Line Breaking Rules, and Writing Modes
In this chapter you will learn about the following properties:
content.html: In this chapter you will learn about the following properties:

content.text: CSS Text Overflow
The CSS text-overflow property specifies how overflowed content that is not displayed should be signaled to the user.
content.html: The CSS text-overflow property specifies how overflowed content that is not displayed should be signaled to the user.

content.text: It can be clipped:
content.html: It can be clipped:

content.text: This is some long text that will not fit in the box
content.html: This is some long text that will not fit in the box

content.text: or it can be rendered as an ellipsis (...):
content.html: or it can be rendered as an ellipsis (...):

content.text: This is some long text that will not fit in the box
content.html: This is some long text that will not fit in the box

content.text: The CSS code is as follows:
content.html: The CSS code is as follows:

content.code_html:
p.test1 {
  white-space: nowrap;
  width: 200px;
  border: 1px solid #000000;
  overflow: hidden;
  text-overflow: clip;
}

p.test2 {
  white-space: nowrap;
  width: 200px;
  border: 1px solid #000000;
  overflow: hidden;
  text-overflow: ellipsis;
}

content.text: The following example shows how you can display the overflowed content when hovering over the element:
content.html: The following example shows how you can display the overflowed content when hovering over the element:

content.code_html:
div.test:hover {
  overflow: visible;
}

content.text: CSS Word Wrapping
The CSS word-wrap property allows long words to be able to be broken and wrap onto the next line.
content.html: The CSS word-wrap property allows long words to be able to be broken and wrap onto the next line.

content.text: If a word is too long to fit within an area, it expands outside:
content.html: If a word is too long to fit within an area, it expands outside:

content.text: This paragraph contains a very long word: thisisaveryveryveryveryveryverylongword. The long word will break and wrap to the next line.
content.html: This paragraph contains a very long word: thisisaveryveryveryveryveryverylongword. The long word will break and wrap to the next line.

content.text: The word-wrap property allows you to force the text to wrap - even if it means splitting it in the middle of a word:
content.html: The word-wrap property allows you to force the text to wrap - even if it means splitting it in the middle of a word:

content.text: This paragraph contains a very long word: thisisaveryveryveryveryveryverylongword. The long word will break and wrap to the next line.
content.html: This paragraph contains a very long word: thisisaveryveryveryveryveryverylongword. The long word will break and wrap to the next line.

content.text: The CSS code is as follows:
content.html: The CSS code is as follows:

content.code_html:
p {
  word-wrap: break-word;
}

content.text: CSS Word Breaking
The CSS word-break property specifies line breaking rules.
content.html: The CSS word-break property specifies line breaking rules.

content.text: This paragraph contains some text. This line will-break-at-hyphens.
content.html: This paragraph contains some text. This line will-break-at-hyphens.

content.text: This paragraph contains some text. The lines will break at any character.
content.html: This paragraph contains some text. The lines will break at any character.

content.text: The CSS code is as follows:
content.html: The CSS code is as follows:

content.code_html:
p.test1 {
  word-break: keep-all;
}

p.test2 {
  word-break: break-all;
}

content.text: CSS Writing Mode
The CSS writing-mode property specifies whether lines of text are laid out horizontally or vertically.
content.html: The CSS writing-mode property specifies whether lines of text are laid out horizontally or vertically.

content.text: Some text with a span element with a vertical-rl writing-mode.
content.html: Some text with a span element with a vertical-rl writing-mode.

content.text: The following example shows some different writing modes:
content.html: The following example shows some different writing modes:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
p.test1 {  writing-mode: horizontal-tb; }span.test2 {  writing-mode: vertical-rl; }p.test2 {  writing-mode: 
   vertical-rl; }

content.code:
p.test1 {  writing-mode: horizontal-tb; }span.test2 {  writing-mode: vertical-rl; }p.test2 {  writing-mode:
vertical-rl; }

syntax_highlighting.text:
p.test1 {  writing-mode: horizontal-tb; }span.test2 {  writing-mode: vertical-rl; }p.test2 {  writing-mode: 
   vertical-rl; }

content.code_html:
p.test1 {
  writing-mode: horizontal-tb;
}

span.test2 {
  writing-mode: vertical-rl;
}

p.test2 {
  writing-mode: vertical-rl;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
p.test1 {  writing-mode: horizontal-tb; }span.test2 {  writing-mode: vertical-rl; }p.test2 {  writing-mode: 
   vertical-rl; }

content.text: CSS Text Effect Properties
The following table lists the CSS text effect properties:
content.html: The following table lists the CSS text effect properties:

content.code_html:
Property Description
text-justify Specifies how justified text should be aligned and spaced
text-overflow Specifies how overflowed content that is not displayed should be signaled to the user
word-break Specifies line breaking rules for non-CJK scripts
word-wrap Allows long words to be able to be broken and wrap onto the next line
writing-mode Specifies whether lines of text are laid out horizontally or vertically
